Name: Burst
Effect: For each Effect rolled, you may spend an additional shot to hit another target within Close range of the primary target

Name: Breaking
Effect: For each Effect rolled, if the target is in cover, reduce the number of Cover Dice a piece of cover provides permantly by 1. Otherwise, reduce the damage resistance on the location struck by 1

Name: Persistent
Effect: If one or more Effects are rolled, the target suffers the weapon's damage again at the end of their next and subsequent turns, for a number of rounds equal to the number of Effects rolled. A character may spend a major action to make a test to stop Persistent damage early; the difficulty is equal to the number of Effects rolled

Name: Piercing 1
Effect: Ignore 1 point of the target's damage reduction for each Effect rolled

Name: Radioactive
Effect: For every Effect rolled, the target also suffers 1 point of Radiation damage

Name: Spread
Effect: For each Effect rolled, your attack inflicts one additional hit on the target. Each additional hit inflicts half the rolled damage and hits a random location

Name: Stun
Effect: If one or more Effects are rolled, the target loses their normal actions in their next turn. A stunned target may still spend AP to take additional actions

Name: Vicious
Effect: The attack inflicts +1 damage for each Effect rolled

Name: Accurate
Effect: If you take the Aim minor action before attacking with an Accurate weapon, you may spend up to 3 AP to add +1 damage dice per AP to the attack's damage

Name: Blast
Effect: When you make an attack with a Blast weapon, select a single zone you can see, and make the appropriate skill test to attack, with a basic difficulty of 2. If you succeed, every target in that zone suffers the weapon's damage. If you fail, roll only half the weapon's to determine the damage inflicted to creatures in the target zone and ignore the weapon's normal damage effects.

Name: Close Quarters
Effect: You suffer no penalty for attacking when within Reach of an enemy

Name: Concealed
Effect: Enemies do not spot this weapon unless you're wielding it, or thet succeed at a PER + Survival test with a difficulty of 2

Name: Debilitating
Effect: The difficulty of any skill test treat to injuries inflicted by this weapon increase by +1.

Name: Gatling
Effect: Ammunition is spent at ten times the normal rate. Whenever spend ammunition to increase you damage, this weapon's damage, add +2 Damage Dice per shot

Name: Inaccurate
Effect: you cannot take the Aim minor action

Name: Mine
Effect: When a Mine is placed it inflicts its damage upon anyone who comes within Reach of it

Name: Night Vision
Effect: When you Aim with a Night Vision weapon, you ignore any penalty due to darkness.

Name: Parry
Effect: When an enemy attempts a melee attack against you, you may spend 1 AP to add +1 to your Defense

Name: Recon
Effect: When you Aim, you may mark the target you aimed at. The next ally to attack that target may re-roll one d20 on their attack.

Name: Reliable
Effect: During each combat encounter, ignore the first complication you roll

Name: Supressed
Effect: If an enemy is not aware of you when you attack, they do not notice the attack unless they are the target or they pass a PER+ Survival test with a difficulty of 2.

Name: Thrown
Effect: This can be thrown

Name: Two-Handed
Effect: Attacking with only one hand increases the difficulty by +2.

Name: Unreliable
Effect: Increase the complication range of attacks by 1.

Name: Re-roll Hit Location
Effect: You may choose to re-roll your hit-location die

Name: Bayonet
Effect: You may make a Melee Weapon with 4 Physical Damage Dice and Piercing 1
